{ "step_by_step_thinking": "Moyer's classification is a system used to describe different types of malocclusion, or misalignment of the teeth. Class II type D malocclusion, according to Moyer's classification, is characterized by an orthognathic maxilla and a retrognathic mandible. Orthognathic refers to normal positioning, while retrognathic refers to a mandible that is positioned too far back.", "answer_choice": "C. Orthognathic maxilla and retrognathic mandible" }
